industry_wish:
I wish the industry understood that Data Engineers need to be domain experts, not just ticket-takers.

Often, requests come in as simple data movement tasks, but technical skills alone aren't enough to guarantee reliability. To build trust, engineers need domain training just as much as they need technical specs. Without understanding the business context, we can only check for generic errors (like null values or record count checks).

When we are trained in the domain, we can write business-specific Data Quality tests and robust reconciliation logic, ensuring that data doesn't just 'load' successfully, but actually matches the reality across source and target systems. Investing in this domain knowledge transforms us from utility providers into strategic partners who ensure data integrity.
